name: Damian Franciszek Pospiech
profile_summary:
Senior Backend Engineer with 13+ years of experience specializing in **Python** development, building robust **microservices** and scalable **APIs** that enhance application performance. Proficient in **containerization** technologies, ensuring seamless deployment and orchestration. Skilled in **asynchronous** programming and **concurrency** concepts aimed at optimizing application efficiency. Adept in **debugging**, **profiling**, and ensuring **observability** in complex systems, and experienced with **streaming** technologies to support real-time data processing.

Strong background in developing AI/ML-driven applications, leveraging tools for advanced analytics and automation. Well-versed in cloud deployment on **AWS** and **Azure**, with a focus on compliance-driven development that meets standards like HIPAA, FHIR, PCI DSS, and SOC 2. A proven track record in applying **MLOps** principles to improve model training and orchestration using **MLflow**, **Airflow**, and **Kubeflow**. Committed to delivering high-performance solutions across the healthcare and financial sectors.

Utilized advanced profiling tools and techniques to identify and eliminate bottlenecks in application performance, optimizing resource utilization by up to **30%**.

Collaborated closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver high-quality backend solutions meeting business needs in a timely manner, with a proven track record of successfully delivering **8+** major projects within stipulated timelines.

Utilized **Python** and extensive **Microservices** architecture to modernize core financial platforms, enhancing scalability and performance for **high-volume transactional systems**.

Ensured compliance with data protection regulations (GDPR) by implementing **role-based access control (RBAC)** and secure authentication protocols like **OAuth 2.0** across all backend services.
Improved throughput by integrating observability tools, reducing erroneous transaction rates by **20%** through effective logging and monitoring of application metrics.
Leveraged **asynchronous** programming patterns to enhance API responsiveness, achieving an application throughput of **500+ requests per second** under load tests.
